review: I started out with some difficulty but found that the problem was not with the Fire Stick but with my WIFI signal strength. since my cable provider corrected that problem, performance has been excellent.

review: Great functionality in a compact form factor.  The interface is nice and easily accessible.  I do wish that it didn't require a separate power cord, but such is life.
author: Jeremy T. Messenger "Todd"

review: I was really excited about this fire TV stick to come in the mail, but unfortunately I had some problems with it connecting to my older TV. It continuously flashed green, even when I rebooted it and did all the things that online tech help guided me through. Even when I was able to get it to work with my other TV, one of the main reasons why I bought the stick, for Netflix, was not working, and has yet to start working a month later.
author: Lachelle

review: Don't include my stars in evaluating this product.  Our house was broken in to when we at a relatives Christmas afternoon and these were stolen before getting the box open.  But, I can't find "ask a question here" ......can this connect to a hotel web based internet connection?  We travel a lot, and rather than all of us huddled around our kindles, it makes sense to buy one of these, but only if I can connect by opening a browser to sign in to the internet.  Otherwise, it's no more use for me then my roku 3, in that respect.  Thanks, anyone that can answer this for me :)
author: A. McGill

review: Wow, Amazon shipped this out to me a month earlier than expected. It was a good surprise Xmas present. This is a good device in the early stages. The software does need a bit of work. There needs to be a way to set the sleep timer. Additionally the sleep button needs to be more easily accessible from the main menu. It's currently buried 4 screens down in the settings menu. The interface is very busy, but still easy to navigate... for the Amazon stuff only. Any of the other vendor stuff (YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, etc.) is buried and bit problematic to find. I get that Amazon is promoting their own stuff, but come on.

review: Really love how easy it is to connect.  We also took it with us when visiting family...just plugged it in and we had all our favorites with us.

review: I received this as a Christmas gift. i just want to state that the video that come from this lil device is so clear. now not all videos are in Hd but the ones that are is amazing. note that not everything is free if you have Prime. there are videos and movies that you have to buy. I got to see how prime is for a month and i didn't get to use it as much as i should of but thats ok. Twitch tv wasn't as clear. using chromecast to stream twitch.tv was much much better. also if you dont have any accounts to like netflix or hbo go or stuff like that these devices are useless and if you have a smart tv. its still useless just another remote to have.
author: Johnny

review: Perhaps once all the bugs are worked out it will be alright. My experience living in Maine with DSL is that I cannot get the 'Help' vids to play that came installed. Things never stop 'loading'. I purchased a fireplace app for Christmas and after spending half an hour or so trying to get it to work I moved on frustrated. I noticed yesterday that a couple of the 11 screen options are working but still not all. Looks awesome but lacks functionality. Trying to find the options for importing local files (without buying additional items - an android operating system driven device smartphone or tablet) is impossible without something like another expense purchasing an app like PLEX. If I had dumped cable or sat for this I'd be bumming for sure. Hoping for brighter days ahead. I hear the Fire box is a good product - but that is not the one I have.
